content: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>  <reference anchor='I-D.ietf-fax-service-v2'> <front> <title>A Simple Mode of Facsimile Using Internet Mail</title>  <author initials='K' surname='Toyoda' fullname='Kiyoshi Toyoda'>     <organization /> </author>  <author initials='H' surname='Ohno' fullname='Hiroyuki  Ohno'>     <organization /> </author>  <author initials='J' surname='Murai' fullname='Jun Murai'>     <organization /> </author>  <author initials='D' surname='Wing' fullname='Dan Wing'>     <organization /> </author>  <date month='November' day='27' year='2001' />  <abstract><t>This specification provides for 'simple mode' carriage of facsimile data using Internet mail. Extensions to this document will follow. The current specification employs standard protocols and file formats such as TCP/IP, Internet mail protocols [1, 2, 3], MIME [4, 10, 11], and TIFF for Facsimile [5, 12, 14].</t></abstract>  </front>  <seriesInfo name='Internet-Draft' value='draft-ietf-fax-service-v2-05' /> <format type='TXT'         target='http://www.ietf.org/internet-drafts/draft-ietf-fax-service-v2-05.txt' /> </reference>
